title: Overview
content: Slayer is a combat skill where Slayer masters assign you specific monsters to kill. It provides access to high-value monster drops, unique Slayer equipment, and a steady source of combat XP. P2P players have access to all Slayer masters and the full range of high-level tasks.
The general strategy is to use the highest-tier master available to you, block bad tasks, extend profitable ones, and push through tasks as efficiently as possible.

title: Choosing Your Slayer Master
content: Always use the highest-tier Slayer master your combat level allows. Higher masters assign better tasks with more Slayer XP and valuable drops.
- Turael (Burthorpe): Combat level 3 — use only for skipping unwanted tasks from other masters
- Mazchna (Morytania): Combat level 20 — early game tasks
- Vannaka (Edgeville Dungeon): Combat level 40
- Chaeldar (Lost City): Combat level 75 — requires Lost City quest
- Sumona (Pollnivneach): Combat level 90 — requires Smoking Kills
- Kuradal (Ancient Cavern): Combat level 110 — recommended from 110+; dungeon monsters give bonus XP
- Morvran (Prifddinas): Combat level 120 — best assignment table; requires Plague's End

title: Points Management
content: Earn Slayer points by completing tasks (bonus points every 10th, 50th, 100th, 250th, and 1000th task). Prioritise your spending wisely.
Key point unlocks for P2P players:
- Broader Fletching: Craft broad bolts — very useful for Fletching skill training
- Slayer Helmet upgrades: Purchase Hexcrest and Focus Sight for the full helmet
- Block list: Block weak tasks (Desert Lizards, Cave Bugs, Banshees) to avoid wasting time
- Extend list: Extend high-value tasks (Abyssal Demons, Gargoyles, Nechryaels)
- Turael skip: Skip one bad task per visit to Turael at the cost of resetting your task streak

title: Recommended High-Value Tasks
content: The most efficient and rewarding Slayer tasks for P2P players:
- Abyssal Demons (85 Slayer): Abyssal whip, orb, wand — valuable items on the GE
- Gargoyles (75 Slayer): Consistent drops of herbs, ores, gems, and granite maul
- Nechryaels (80 Slayer): Excellent herb drops; good XP rate
- Spiritual Mages (83 Slayer): Dragon boots — high value on the Grand Exchange
- Dark Beasts (90 Slayer): Dark bow, death talisman drops
- Glacors (96 Slayer): Glacyte boots, armadyl battlestaff components
- Airuts (92 Slayer): High combat XP, good charm drop rates
- Automatons (67 Slayer): Valuable glove drops (Pneumatic, Tracking, Sparkling)

title: Boss Slayer Tasks
content: Assigning bosses as Slayer tasks (purchased with Slayer points) gives bonus Slayer XP on top of boss loot. Highly recommended for experienced players.
- GWD1 Bosses (Bandos, Armadyl, etc.): Standard mid-game boss tasks
- Araxxor/Araxxi (92 Slayer): Noxious weapons components and spider web drops
- The Magister (115 Slayer): Khopeshes and Port Gwaenith materials
- Kalphite King: Drygore weapons; one of the strongest mid-game boss tasks
- Telos, the Warden (80+ enrage): Planted Feet perk, anima core equipment
Boss tasks provide the best Slayer XP per hour at endgame alongside valuable unique drops.

title: Slayer Codex and Sunken Pyramid
content: Players with at least level 99 Slayer can fill their Slayer Codex. For every 20 souls collected, Slayer helmets grant a +1% Slayer XP gain bonus (up to 5% at 100 souls). Investing time to reach 100 souls is worthwhile for long-term gains.
Players with level 99 Slayer also gain access to the Sunken Pyramid, a personal dungeon where you can assign specific Slayer rooms and optimise task completion in a controlled environment.

title: Useful Items
content: - Full Slayer Helmet: +15% melee and +12.5% range/magic damage while on task; combine all components
- Herbicide: Auto-destroys herbs for passive Herblore XP during tasks
- Bonecrusher: Auto-buries bones; pair with Demon horn necklace for Prayer restoration
- Aggression potion: Forces nearby monsters to attack you — enables AFK Slayer
- Slayer Cape: Teleport to any Slayer master for free once at 99
- Ferocious ring: Teleport to Kuradal's Dungeon; +4 strength bonus while in the dungeon
